main.name: Nicholas Prussen
main.description: studying Computer Science in my Junior year at Boise State University
main.bio: Computer Science major in my junior year at Boise State University. I'm very passionate about programming and I absolutely love jumping into the deep end on new projects and new languages. Lately I've begun a summer internship at Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) working on internal tools and bug prediction.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Data Structures, Linear Algebra, Databases, Systems Programming, Programming Languages, Discrete Mathematics

work.title: Intern
work.description: Working on proprietary internal tools to help aid in bug prediction and cut down on bug diagnosing time.

work.title: Student Researcher
work.description: Working alonside professors and students to create data flow optimizations with programming languages and transformations. Currently doing Web Development for the Parflow team to integrate benchmark results stored in MongoDB to be displayed on a dynamic website using React and Flask. Previously worked on the Adapt Lidar Tools project.
work.projectonedescription: Adapt Lidar Tools is a collection of full waveform processing tools written in C++11. This was the first Adapt Lab project I worked on and I primarily worked on benchmarking the suite of tools and helping refactor the codebase.
work.projecttwodescription: Parflow Performance Testing is a benchmark suite for the Parflow project which simulates ground water movement for the continental Unites States. I started by learning MongoDB and Python as a means to upload benchmark results to a database. Currently I'm working on learning to integrate React, Flask and Chart.js to create an interactable website that can display benchmarks results to the end user in a convenient and intuitive way.

projects.title: Adapt Lidar Tools
projects.category: An array of tools for processing full-waveform lidar data.

projects.title: Parflow Performance Testing
projects.category: A set of benchmarks for the Parflow project.

projects.title: Wumpus World App
projects.category: My CS121 project, which I rebuilt using Android Studio into an Android App published on the Play Store.

projects.title: Parflow Performance Benchmarks Website
projects.category: Currently being built using React, Flask and MongoDB. Still in development but will be public when finished.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
